title: Why has Germany shut down its nuclear plants?
description: Critics have long described the energy source as dangerous and unsustainable.

title: Army and rival forces clash as power struggle rocks Sudan
description: Fierce fighting erupts in the capital, Khartoum, and elsewhere, dealing a new blow to hopes for transition to democracy.

title: Thousands of Israelis in new protests against judicial reforms
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delayed the proposed overhaul in late March but opponents want it scrapped.

title: Germany ends nuclear energy era as last reactors power down
description: Germany's nuclear exit was delayed to this year after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine wreaked havoc in energy markets.

title: Poland suspends food imports from Ukraine to assist its farmers
description: Poland's governing party leader Jarosław Kaczyński says the list of banned items would include grain and honey.

title: A small dip in Islamophobia in the US give us hope
description: Last year CAIR registered a decline in the number of complaints from Muslim Americans for the first time since 1995.

title: Analysis: Fighting erupts in Sudan after months of tension
description: Friction between the army and the RSF paramilitary group was exacerbated by Sudan's political process, analysts say.

title: Three arrested over animal rights plan to disrupt Grand National
description: Activists called for protests against the prestigious horse race to demand an end to 'animal cruelty for entertainment'.

title: Azerbaijan slams flag burning at weightlifting event in Armenia
description: Azerbaijan withdraws from European Weightlifting Championships after Azeri flag burned during the opening ceremony.

title: World powers condemn escalation in Sudan as clashes continue
description: Heavy fighting could mean prolonged strife across a country already dealing with economic breakdown.

title: Macron signs France pension reform into law despite protests
description: The Constitutional Council rules in favour of key provisions of the reform, including raising the retirement age.

title: Dozens of Yemeni rebels fly from Saudi Arabia in prisoner swap
description: The flight takes off from the southern Saudi city of Abha, headed for Sanaa, with 120 Houthi rebel prisoners.

title: Leak suspect yearned to join US military but then regretted it
description: Teixeira, 21, was charged on Friday in US District Court in Boston with unauthorised removal of classified documents.

title: US intel leaks and the war in Ukraine
description: Washington does damage control after leak of classified documents reveals sensitive information about Ukraine war.

title: Heavy gunfire heard in Sudan’s capital Khartoum
description: Witnesses reported explosions and gunfire near a base held by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces.

title: Can the World Bank’s new president fix the institution?
description: World leaders are pushing for 'fundamental' reform of the World Bank to better tackle climate change.

title: Zaw Min Tun: Myanmar’s army is in power, but is it in control?
description: Myanmar's deputy information minister discusses military rule, anti-coup forces, and continuing ethnic conflict.

title: Japan PM unharmed after ‘smoke bomb’ at campaign event
description: Crowd at fishing harbour in western Japan scattered in panic after explosion as police subdued a man at the scene.

title: Pence booed at NRA meeting in US as he tries to outflank Trump
description: Republican presidential hopefuls are courting the US's powerful gun lobby even as mass shootings continue.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 416
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 416th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: S Korea, Japan, US to deepen security ties amid N Korea threat
description: Allies condemn 'in the strongest terms' Pyongyang's latest weapons test, and urge end to 'destabilization'.

title: Montana legislators vote to ban popular social media app TikTok
description: The vote is likely to lead to legal challenges as US politicians express concerns over the app's ties to China.

title: Dozens killed in Democratic Republic of the Congo village attacks
description: 'We're tired of it,' say residents facing ongoing violence in the Ituri province, near the border with Uganda.
